metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15657 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Firefox could be made to load attacker-supplied DLL files from the installation directory. This required an attacker that is already capable of placing files in the installation directory. *Note: This issue only affected Windows operating systems. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
